elements.title: Lillian Eichler Watson (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Lillian Eichler Watson created "Again She Orders – 'A Chicken Salad, Please'" (pictured) to advertise her 1921 Book of Etiquette?

elements.title: Shotley Pier (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that sponsors were asked to buy planks for the restoration of Shotley Pier in Suffolk, England, at £100 each?

elements.title: John C. Young (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that John C. Young served as president of Centre College for nearly 27 years, longer than any other president in the school's history?

elements.title: Comtal Corporation (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Comtal Corporation's products were used by NASA to process digital images of the surface of Mars and flybys of Jupiter in the 1970s?

elements.title: David Gee Cheng (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that David Gee Cheng was appointed as a member of the Indonesian cabinet just three years after he became an Indonesian citizen?

elements.title: Alaska marmots (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Alaska marmots take turns acting as sentries to protect their colonies?

elements.title: Father Chrysanthus (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Dutch arachnologist Father Chrysanthus was the only person to make the International Society of Arachnology's first congress "international"?

elements.title: Guild Theatre (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that at the Guild Theatre, the higher an actor ascended, the farther they were from stardom?
